error.signature: connection refused / connection timed out due to NetworkPolicy

verdict.summary: NetworkPolicy is blocking traffic between pods. Once a NetworkPolicy selects a pod, all non-allowed traffic is denied by default.

dead_ends.action: Delete all NetworkPolicies in the namespace
dead_ends.why_fails: Removes security controls — exposes all pods to unrestricted network access

dead_ends.action: Use hostNetwork: true to bypass NetworkPolicy
dead_ends.why_fails: Bypasses all network isolation — major security risk and port conflicts

workarounds.action: Add allow rules for the required traffic: create ingress/egress rules matching the source/destination pods
workarounds.how: kubectl get networkpolicy -n <ns> -o yaml, then add podSelector/namespaceSelector rules for allowed traffic

workarounds.action: Verify the CNI plugin supports NetworkPolicy (not all do)
workarounds.how: Calico, Cilium, and Weave support NetworkPolicy; Flannel does NOT by default

leads_to.condition: when NetworkPolicy blocks egress to CoreDNS

preceded_by.condition: when debugging connectivity and NetworkPolicy is the real cause

frequently_confused_with.distinction: NetworkPolicy block affects all traffic to/from selected pods, while DNS resolution failure specifically affects name resolution
